Poker¶

Poker¶

class games.poker.game.poker.Poker(session_id: uuid.UUID)¶

Class for the game of poker

add_player(player: accounts.models.CustomUser) → None¶

Adds a player to the game

Parameters

player – player to be added

check_move_to_next_stage() → None¶

Checks if it is time to move to the next stage of the game

dict_representation(user: accounts.models.CustomUser)¶

Returns a dictionary representation of the poker session data, used for web application when we want to get some information about the poker game

Parameters

user – user who is requesting the dictionary

Returns

dictionary containing information about the poker session

Updates a players ready state

Parameters

  • player – player to update

  • ready_state – if the player is ready

Adds a player to the game

Parameters

player – player to be added

reset() → None¶

Resets the current game

Starts a round of poker

class games.poker.game.poker.PokerHand(player, hand, board)¶

Hand class for poker game

check_flush() → tuple[str, int]¶

Checks if the hand is a flush

Returns

A tuple of the hand class and the integer value of the hand

Checks if hand is a four of a kind

Returns

A tuple of the hand class and the integer value of the hand

check_full_house() → tuple[str, int]¶

Checks if hand is a full house

Returns

A tuple of the hand class and the integer value of the hand

check_high_card() → tuple[str, int]¶

Returns the high cards

Returns

A tuple of the hand class and the integer value of the hand

check_one_pair() → tuple[str, int]¶

checks if the hand contains a pair

Returns

A tuple of the hand class and the integer value of the hand

check_straight() → tuple[str, int]¶

Checks if the hand is a straight, can either be with Ace as the highest card or with Ace representing a 1 for the lowest straight possible of A, 2, 3, 4, 5

Returns

A tuple of the hand class and the integer value of the hand

check_straight_flush() → tuple[str, int]¶

Checks if hand is a straight flush

Returns

A tuple of the hand class and the integer value of the hand

check_three_of_a_kind() → tuple[str, int]¶

Checks if a hand is a 3 of a kind

Returns

A tuple of the hand class and the integer value of the hand

check_two_pairs() → tuple[str, int]¶

Checks if a card is a two pair

Returns

A tuple of the hand class and the integer value of the hand

Returns

The users hand and the cards in the board

static get_five_or_more_consecutive_cards(ranks: list) → list¶

Returns a list of 5+ cards if they are all consecutive

Parameters

ranks – list of ranks to be checked

Returns

List of lists that contain the consecutive streaks

Computed the hand value for a passed in hand

Parameters

playable_hand – the playable hand (players hand plus the board’s cards)

Returns

A tuple of the hand class and the integer value of the hand

rank_frequency()¶
Returns

A counter of the frequency of each rank in the poker hand

suit_frequency()¶
Returns

A counter of the frequency of each suit in the poker hand

class games.poker.game.poker.PokerRound(deck, players)¶

Class for a round of poker

change_turn() → None¶

Moves the current turn to the next user in line that hasn’t folded or is the last person to raise to close action

check_round_end() → None¶

Checks if the round is over and ends the round if it is.

deal_cards()¶

Shuffles and deals cards to everyone sitting down at the table, starting the new round

dict_representation(user: accounts.models.CustomUser) → dict¶

Returns a dictionary representation of the poker session data, used for web application when we want to get some information about the poker game

Parameters

user – user who is requesting the dictionary

Returns

dictionary containing information about the poker session

end_round() → None¶

Ends the current round after the board has circled around to the last raiser when the action is closed

evaluate_winner() → None¶

Evaluates all hands among each of the players that haven’t folded and determines who won

player_action(player: accounts.models.CustomUser, action: str, bet: float) → None¶

Whenever a player makes a move, will update if it is the users turn. When the current turn passes the last player to act, it will end the turn to close the action

Parameters

  • player – player to execute action for

  • action – a dictionary containing the action to bet, fold or call/check.

  • bet – bet amount

player_bet(player: accounts.models.CustomUser, bet: float) → None¶

Places bet for a player

Parameters

  • player – player to place bet for

  • bet – bet amount

player_call(player: accounts.models.CustomUser) → None¶

The user has decided to make the call or check

Parameters

player – player to call

remove_player(player: accounts.models.CustomUser) → None¶

Removes a player from a poker round

Parameters

player – player to be removed

reset_stakes() → None¶

Updates the stakes of the players in the hand

update_board() → None¶

Updates the board with the next card or evaluates the winner

Consumers¶

class games.poker.web.consumers.PokerConsumer(*args, **kwargs)¶

Web socket consumer for poker game

connect()¶

Handles connecting a user to game channel and registering them for the session when a user connects to the web socket

disconnect(code)¶

Handles removing a user from the game channel and removing them from the session when a player navigates away from the game web page

Parameters

code – exit code

individual_game_load(event: dict) → None¶

Loads the game for each web socket connection

Parameters

event – Event to send. Data must be under ‘data’ key
